pros: Great People, awesome facilities! Safe and secure
cons: Nothing to really say negative only positive experiences

No option to work remotely, everything is always super formal, the buildings are full of mold and make you sick, you are overworked and very much underpaid! You'll be micromanaged. People are never fired for poor quality work which means the people who do good work pick up the slack. There are no opportunities for advancement. Many of the people in leadership positions are there because of political affiliation (baseball friends, sexual acquaintances, etc.)

pros: There were good benefits and most employees are really nice.
cons: There were some leadership issues and the pay could've been better for entry-level and mid-level roles.

job_title: Work Study Student in Hattiesburg, MS
pros: The staff was kind and caring. Great atmosphere to be around.
cons: I didn't have nearly enough time with them.

pros: Great place to work and great people to work with
cons: Not the highest paying job but great working conditions

pros: Small town, pleasant co-workers.  Cafeteria food is awesome.
cons:
It's all about appearances.  We can spend millions of dollars on a "courtyard", which is really just a fancy sidewalk, drop another couple mil on a football stadium, but our academic buildings are straight out of the 70s.

Salaries are stagnant.  You have to wait until someone dies or retires to get a raise.

job_title: Health Care Data Student Worker in Laurel, MS
pros: Great learning experience.  Great practice towards your major . I got to meet a lot of people and it was just an overall great experience I would do it all over again.
cons: The only kind I see to working there is that you are at the school pretty much all of the time otherwise it is fine

pros: great pay and benefits, fun job
cons: work environment is all about who knows who, and they play favorites
